intro: Geigeria elongata, commonly known as the slender geigeria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are elongated and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats.
